info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 10:42PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A BAND OF SNOW WILL AFFECT NORTHERN JEFFERSON...COLUMBIANA... NORTHERN CARROLL...MERCER...BEAVER...SOUTHWESTERN VENANGO... LAWRENCE...BUTLER...NORTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG...SOUTHWESTERN CLARION AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 1041 PM EDT, snow showers were located along a line extending from near Grove City to 8 miles east of Minerva. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. Locations impacted include... New Castle, Hermitage, Sharon, Butler, Salem, East Liverpool, Beaver Falls, Grove City, Columbiana, Monaca, East Palestine, and Sharpsville. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 85 and 127. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 45. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 40. Snow will lead to reduced visibilities and hazardous travel conditions. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
